name: Saarthal Burial Sigil
origin: Saarthal Excavation Site â€” Sentinel Ash
description: A stone medallion recovered from sentinel ash in Saarthal's inner chambers. Carved with ancient Nordic runes that pulse faintly with residual ward-magic. The sigil appears to be a key component for bypassing or stabilizing failing Nordic wards.

special_ability.name: Ward Bypass
special_ability.effect: When used at appropriate ward-sealed passages in Saarthal, grants +2 to Lore rolls to analyze, bypass, or stabilize ancient Nordic ward magic. Can be invoked as an aspect for +2 or reroll when dealing with Saarthal's ward systems.
special_ability.cost: Narrative permission (must be at relevant ward location)
special_ability.limitation: Only functions within Saarthal; no combat or general magic bonus

lore_significance: Burial sigils were used by ancient Nordic priests to mark sanctified remains and control ward access. This particular sigil suggests the sentinel whose ashes contained it held significant authority in Saarthal's final days.
story_impact: Key to progressing deeper into Saarthal. May provide insight into the ruins' history and the circumstances of its fall. Tolfdir or other College scholars may express interest in studying it after the expedition.

acquisition.method: Looted from sentinel ash during time-pressure encounter
acquisition.roll: Notice Overcome, invoked Saarthal Resonance Attunement
